options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of past water and a habitable environment

title: Can we eat to starve cancer? - William Li

What is the name of the therapy that involves cutting off the blood supply to cancer cells?
According to the speaker, what is the main reason why anti-angiogenic therapy may not be effective in all cases of cancer?

options.label: C
options.text: Cancer cells are too resistant to treatment

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Toward a science of simplicity - George Whitesides

multiple-choice.question: What characteristic do many of the speakers at the talk have in common?

options.label: A
options.text: They are all experts in their field and have a deep understanding of the topic of simplicity.

options.label: B
options.text: They are all from the same industry.

options.label: C
options.text: They all have a high level of experience in their field.

options.label: D
options.text: They all think they know what simplicity is, but actually don't.

multiple-choice.question: According to the Potter Stewart opinion on pornography, what is the speaker's stance on defining hardcore pornography?

options.label: A
options.text: The speaker believes that it can be easily defined.

options.label: B
options.text: The speaker believes that it cannot be intelligibly defined.

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker believes that it is not necessary to define it.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker believes that it is too complex to define.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between complexity and simplicity according to the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: Complexity is more predictable than simplicity.

options.label: B
options.text: Simplicity is more complex than complexity.

options.label: C
options.text: Complexity is fundamentally intractable, while simplicity is not.

options.label: D
options.text: Complexity is more evolved than simplicity.

multiple-choice.question: What are some examples of simple things that are also complex in their construction?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the most complex way of representing numbers.

options.label: B
options.text: It is the simplest way of representing numbers.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the most ambiguous way of representing numbers.

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most difficult way of representing numbers.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the device that is used to represent binary numbers?

options.label: D
options.text: A device that turns things on and off without moving parts, such as a transistor.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what are the key characteristics of simple things?

options.label: A
options.text: They are complex and have many components.

options.label: B
options.text: They are simple and have few components.

options.label: C
options.text: They are predictable, cheap, and serve as building blocks.

options.label: D
options.text: They are reliable and have a high performance-to-cost ratio.

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a simple technology that has been used to make medical diagnosis more accessible?

options.label: C
options.text: A paper chip that changes color in response to urine.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the key principle of design that should be followed?

options.label: A
options.text: Make things as complex as possible.

options.label: B
options.text: Make things as simple as possible but not simpler.

options.label: C
options.text: Make things as cheap as possible.

options.label: D
options.text: Make things as functional as possible.

options.label: A
options.text: Predictive Analytics for the US Health Care system.

options.label: C
options.text: Developing simple technologies for medical diagnosis.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the characteristic of a system that is considered complex?

options.label: A
options.text: It has few components that interact with each other.

options.label: B
options.text: It has many components that interact with each other and dissipate energy.

options.label: C
options.text: It is simple and has a clear understanding of its behavior.

options.label: D
options.text: It is predictable and has a low performance-to-cost ratio.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the problem posed by the speaker to illustrate the complexity of simplicity?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for more complex systems to be built.

options.label: B
options.text: It enables the creation of more reliable and predictable systems.

options.label: C
options.text: It reduces the cost of development and maintenance.

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the performance-to-cost ratio of systems.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the relationship between simplicity and predictability?

options.label: C
options.text: Simplicity and predictability are related, as simple systems are more predictable.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the key principle of design that should be followed when creating simple technologies?

options.label: A
options.text: Make things as complex as possible.

options.label: B
options.text: Make things as simple as possible but not simpler.

options.label: C
options.text: Make things as cheap as possible.

options.label: D
options.text: Make things as functional as possible.

options.label: A
options.text: It allows for more complex systems to be built.

options.label: B
options.text: It enables the creation of more reliable and predictable systems.

options.label: C
options.text: It reduces the cost of development and maintenance, making it more accessible to people in developing countries.

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the performance-to-cost ratio of systems.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the role of simplicity in the design of the internet?

options.label: A
options.text: Simplicity is not relevant to the design of the internet.

options.label: B
options.text: Simplicity is a key component of the internet's design.

options.label: C
options.text: Simplicity is a byproduct of the internet's design.

options.label: D
options.text: Simplicity is a goal of the internet's design.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the relationship between simplicity and cost?

options.label: C
options.text: Simplicity and cost are related, as simple systems are cheaper to develop and maintain.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the role of simplicity in the development of new technologies?

options.label: A
options.text: Simplicity is not relevant to the development of new technologies.

options.label: B
options.text: Simplicity is a key component of the development of new technologies.

options.label: C
options.text: Simplicity is a byproduct of the development of new technologies.

options.label: D
options.text: Simplicity is a goal of the development of new technologies.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the relationship between simplicity and the potential for innovation?

options.label: C
